remarks: Two equivalent ways of expressing that ` R ` is a superposition of ` P ` and ` Q ` .  (Contributed by NM, 5-Nov-2012.)
statement:
cvlsupr2.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
cvlsupr2.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
cvlsupr2.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
cvlsupr2 $p |- ( ( K e. CvLat /\ ( P e. A /\ Q e. A /\ R e. A ) /\ P =/= Q ) -> ( ( P .\/ R ) = ( Q .\/ R ) <-> ( R =/= P /\ R =/= Q /\ R .<_ ( P .\/ Q ) ) ) ) $.
